title: Give J4 the Azir treatment!!!
body:
J4's ult description is that it is a "impassable" wall....then why is it that riven can Q in and out like it's some kinda joke? Make it so that dashes can't pass through, but blinks like flash can still get away. Now days, almost every meta champion has some sort of mobility, making J4's ult at best,  very situational.

Edit: Perhaps nerfing a bit of j4's damage in exchange for his ult being actually capable of trapping people inside.

A low cool down ult that almost always forces a flash is a very very good ability. If you don't have flash and your dash is on cool down/non existent, you're pretty much screwed.

His ult just doesn't feel significant in late game team fights, once u jump in, ur like the only one left in ur ult (other than people who actually wanna be in there).

Why change an aspect of J4 that doesn't need to be changed? The execute is fine, if it's not broken don't fix it. It  would be like nerfing Annie's burst and giving Tibbers more power. It might make sense thematically, but it would be a huge nerf to Annie and even if she was compensated with Tibbers, she would be an entirely different champion by the end of it.

Why nerf his damage?
As Royal put it, Why change an aspect of J4 that doesn't need to be changed. He's fun to play, he's not too popular now, he has counter play but is a reliable pick and a godly team fighter.

Why give him -more- team fight capability in exchange for making him a useless duelist? People play him outside of the tank jungle meta you know. Does it anger you that a champion who was originally conceived as a laning champion is actually seeing play in lane as intended?

Straight from the wiki :Tumble cannot move Vayne over _**impassible terrain**_, but it does allow her to pass through minions and monsters. 

Jarvan IV leaps to an enemy champion, dealing physical damage to them and creating a 325-radius circle of _**impassable**_ terrain around themselves.

I've seen people _walk_ out of J4's ult. It's not a reliable way to escape, but when the walls so thin that once in a while you can just stroll away it might be time to take a look at them. It's getting to the point where I try to use the ult as burst damage, and the walls are more of a secondary effect that's nice if they manage to trap someone. It should be the other way around.
